details.body:
Following the membership-wide trawl for nominations to the newly-constituted Government Property Profession Board we are pleased to announce the following have been successful:

  • Deborah Rowland, Ministry of Justice: Facilities Management
  • Richard McKinney, Defence Infrastructure Organisation: Planning & Development, Environment, Infrastructure, Geomatics and Building Control
  • Ronald Heeley, VOA: Quantity Surveying and Construction
  • Rachel Brown, Department for Transport: Project Management
  • Niall Walsh, VOA: Valuation
  • Richard Waterhouse, VOA: Residential
  • John Richards, DEFRA: Commercial Surveying

In addition to the above, the following have offered their services to support the lead members in their responsibilities:

  • Peter Penney, HMRC: Facilities Management
  • Jane Hallett, Defence Infrastructure Organisation: Environment
  • Richard Bryan, VOA: Quantity Surveying and Construction
  • Patrick Donohue, GPU: Commercial Surveying (Investment)

Everyone is looking forward to a new and exciting period in the development of the profession under the new governance team.

Sherin Aminossehe will chair the Board as Head of Profession and will continue to be supported by Andrew Howarth as Head of Capability Improvement.
